topic.title: Can we still reasonably enforce an ban on child porn?
topic.body:
Seeing, that decentralized networks are on the rise now, I think think is an interesting question to think about and one that has to answered fairly soon. 

I personally think we should no longer ban child porn since enforcing that ban is:
1) Really expensive
2) Does not solve the problems it(the ban) intended to solve.
3) Leads to more and more extreme surveillance measures, because anonymous and decentralized systems are slowly getting more and more traction(freenet, gnunet, tor, i2p, ipfs, blockchains, zeronet just to name a few).
Opinions on that(and the question)?
(Credit for raising that question to me: @CoinCloudGuy)

topic.title: Zeronet on tails
topic.body:
Does anyone know (or can figure out) how to use zeronet within [tails](https://tails.boum.org/)(clearnet!)?
I've just seen a post on millchan asking the same question and I couldn't find much about it.
The only things I found where [this](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/610)(clearnet!) issue on github and [this](https://www.reddit.com/r/zeronet/comments/3o536u/any_chance_of_zeronet_working_on_tails_debian/)(clearnet!) post on the zeronet subreddit, both of which are unsolved and 2 years old. I don't know nearly enough about the inner workings of zeronet or tails to do anything, but the ability to install it on an tails flash drive, would immensely increase the anonymity and security of zeronet.

Because while child abuse(like in hurting them) cannot be tolerated and must be destroyed, I (in theory!) can certainly imagine ways of making child porn that would not do any harm to the child. >In ZeroNet you can block zites and users personally for you. It will cut down at least a part of possibilities of distribution.
But wouldn't that solve nothing, since (kind of by design of zeronet) the people seeding a zite will be those, who use it. >I'd have dated those born as late as Denise

> [blazar](#comment_30_1P1baCe1LLjror4CZjChWFy7D7cVWyPL83)
>But psychological part is very complicated.
I'm confused. Do you mean the psychological effect on the child or the psychology in perceiving what constitutes as a child? If you mean the psychological effect on the child, than read the answer I gave to thunder33345 in this post, since I explained my thoughts on that there.

> [blazar](#comment_30_1P1baCe1LLjror4CZjChWFy7D7cVWyPL83)

What problem does it solve exactly? Wouldn't that just force the pedophile community and the normal community further apart? Since like pineapples said, there is no way to remove/censor childporn from zeronet:
> [pineapples](#comment_5_19XCfah7iuo9zYqk7GoTDXVNp4p5BpEH1T): i think that the only thing a zeronet user can do about cp is to not seed it. if you stumble across it remove the zite from ur data folder or block it so that you dont accidentally visit that zite again. those who wish to view it and make it always will find a way to do so, therefore there is no point in trying to censor it. its a difficult issue to deal with and given the way zeronet works, there is no way to censor it on this platform
 By refusing to talk to each other(or rather listen to them) wouldn't this only worsen the situation?

> [blazar](#comment_30_1P1baCe1LLjror4CZjChWFy7D7cVWyPL83)
>The only thing will remain is to catch pedophiles IRL.
Do you mean catch those who attack children or in general? Because if you meant in general, to say that would be difficult would be an understatement. As far as I know pedophilia is kind of like a gentic(?) thing that you're born with, I've seen estimates that the percentage of pedophiles inside any given population range from 0.04% all the way up to around 25%. Assuming that applies to the worldpopulation, that would, on the low estimate, mean catching 2.8 million people and somehow deal with them(or god forbid, dispose of them). On top of that you would need to deal with 0.004 times whatever the global birth rate is of people, since pedophilia seems to something you're born with.


> [thunder33345](#comment_102_1AHEQxyRG9s6owyJHShB4U4rg9GL5FMX5K)
>Yes but what about consent? yes you can do that without any harm on them but what will they think in the future?
The more I think about this the more it fascinates me. If I think back to my childhood, my relatives(parents, cousins...) would have me do weird things(from the perspective of 8 year old me) pretty often, like leaning an instrument or how to play tennis and I didn't understood why I had to do these things/go there twice or thrice a week and subsequently didn't want to. After some time I really enjoyed being there and doing them. I had fun doing the very same things I previously hated doing/didn't know existed. Now, to me, it wouldn't really be that far of a stretch to extend this to sex as well. That is, to see sex as some kind of free time activity a kid can do, just like tennis, playing instruments, art classes or what else there is for kids. I'm not saying that all kids will like it, it would depend on their personality, some kids won't like it and move on to piano or tennis. What fascinates me by this is: Imagine yourself being a kid again, would you have minded joining a 'sex-club'? Would you regret it now if you had done so?
For me, I think, the answer is no, I wouldn't have minded that. That of course is not to say I would have enjoyed it, but I really don't think I would have regretted it.

Otherwise I absolutely agree with you and have actually nothing more to add to that.

But yeah, this is nice, being able to talk calmly with other people about (especially)this matter.

> [blazar](#comment_31_1P1baCe1LLjror4CZjChWFy7D7cVWyPL83)
>I mean psychological determination of pedophile and reasons of such deviant behavior. This is the most important subject for today because radical pedophilophobia is dangerous phenomenon for people just like another witch hunt.
I agree, to further add to this I'd like to quote what CoinCloudGuy said somewhere else:
>to me, the very concept of banning data is laughable. Banning of any kind of data, leads to logical conclusions, that can only be described as dumb, it is borderline impossible to enforce and mathematically guaranteed to fail, at about any point in the chain of actions, that need to take place, to ban some piece of data. And in case of CP, this gets extra stupid, because of unnecessarily(and unreasonably) high punishments, the, more than fuzzy, definition on what CP even is and the fact, that the lack of reason, forces people to have to just accept some absolutes(like all pedos are threats to children and so on), for no reason other then, they have to be true in order for the CP ban and the hunt for it, to even be plausible
(If someone wants the source (or me quoting the rest) of his post I will give it to you. It's just that I don't want to give the place this was posted on attention, as it is a pedophile-forum)

>Psychological effect on the child is complicated question too but generally it comes from physical effect (and probably from observation of a physical effect). Moreover: there are a lot of adults with infantilism and some childs with adult world view.
I agree with that, as well.

>ZeroNet is just technology - not a network. Social problems should be solved not with technology in general.

>I mean arresting criminals and preventing crimes.[...]
>If pedophile community will stay away from the normal one then it will be much more easy to identify and catch them.
Are you saying that pedophile==criminal therefore we must catch them all or am I misinterpreting you(because I think I am)?

>Also distribution of a child porn will not use resources of normal community.
I don't think it would've anyway, since the only people seeding a zite are those who use it. So the only way, that resources of the normal community would be used is if someone visited an childporn zite, did not delete it immediately after realizing what it was and forgot about it.

>There must be more reliable ways.
You mean as in identifying pedophiles?

>Anyway strong and healthly community is the solution.
Maybe, but what exactly would a 'healthy community' be?
And more importantly: How would it(ideally) react to the pedophile community?
Ignoring? Banning? Smiting? Understanding? Discussing?
(This sounds a bit aggressive the way I worded that, but I didn't intend for this, to be aggressive in any way toward you, I was just wording my thoughts about it.)


> [styromaniac](#comment_48_16NS3rBdW9zpLmLSQoD8nLTtNVsRFtVBhd)
>I can imagine that change to age of consent will lower the bar for how victims are treated after the fact to how adult victims are treated.
>

I never really thought about that. However that is injustice anyway, because the law for that would work and would be fair, if only enforced(so this would be 'Law: intact' and 'Enforcement: broken' instead of 'Law: broken' and 'Enforcement: intact'), it makes it different kind of issue and therefore is somewhat of a mood point in this context(however definitely not to be ignored either), I think.

On the issue with the blocklists:
I agree with @thunder33345 here:
>While on clearnet it's acceptable that only few person have control of the "block list"here, it's not the same, if i disagree on you blocking the site, i will just fork yours and advertise mine with reason why you should use mine not his, and then all hell will break loose, we will end up with millions of blocklist because everyone disagree with everyone on if one which sites should be blocked or not. Which is why i think this wont work without some sort of self/community moderating system
and @quantumkitty here:
>Here's another way to look at it: You can't undo child-abuse by simply deleting a file. The abuse has already been done.
and here:
>The only thing that will ever work on ZeroNet is a moral deterrent. Ultimately, ZeroNet is a place of self-responsibility. People here are expected to control themselves, not control others.
In addition to that I'd like to add: Default blocklists are, however, a type of censorship, which is exactly what we wanted to avoid in the first place. 
There is also the problem of where to stop blocking stuff. Just Videos? Images? Audio? What about lolicon? Also block out discussions between them? And why stop there? Why not also block 'that annoying Nazi stuff', that will eventually wash it's way here? Why not the 'communism nonsence'? Why not...
I think you see what I'm getting at. Finding a spot to stop blocking is really hard and justifying why there and not just one step more to others is even harder than that. 
And than there is also the problem, that moral is primarily taught/learned, not something you are inherently born with, which means, that whatever is defensively crossing lines for you, is not crossing anything for the person next to you.


> [quantumkitty](#comment_91_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEaQbNZu): Ultimately, ZeroNet is a place of self-responsibility. People here are expected to control themselves, not control others.
> [quantumkitty](#comment_92_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEaQbNZu): Which is why - if you really want ZeroNet to remain free - you should think about bringing back old school vigilante hacking.
But these to statements directly contradict each other...
Or did I misunderstood you?
(What I got from it: We do not control others, only ourselves <=> We will attack them)


On a (kind of related) side note: I feel like there is an argument to be made here, that once a piece of privacy enhancing, secure communication software(the ones made, to protect those in need of protection) is published, pedophiles are consistently the first ones to use them(for examples see: I2P, Freenet, Tor, Zeronet(or rather BitTorrent in general), IPFS and so on).

> [vanadium](#comment_3_19Qid9uyfWCTmx2cUpDboEKCscRd4fRWrL): It does look like it, I had to reinstall the zeronetbundle(and transfer the data-directory and so on) in order to get the update to rev 3468.

Ok, I figured out what is happening: In the past the update-button would just be downloading the latest version from github, which is always the latest and most recent rev. ~~Some update (probably rev3465) changed that, instead of github~~ If you have visited and downloaded [this](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1UPDatEDxnvHDo7TXvq6AEBARfNkyfxsp) zite before, the new version is downloaded from there. This is good, since zeronet now only requires external clearweb sites if you are installing it(where it will still download the latest version from github). This leads to that weird situation, that you press update on a freshly installed rev3470 and it 'updates' you to rev 3465.
